intro: Viola robusta, commonly known as the hardy violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with upright stems and clusters of flowers at the top. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Viola robusta is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
